title: Rural Municipality of Frenchman Butte No. 501
text:
The Rural Municipality of Frenchman Butte No. 501 (<a href="Canada%202016%20Census">2016 population</a>: ) is a <a href="List%20of%20rural%20municipalities%20in%20Saskatchewan">rural municipality</a> (RM) in the <a href="Provinces%20and%20territories%20of%20Canada">Canadian province</a> of <a href="Saskatchewan">Saskatchewan</a> within <a href="Division%20No.%2017%2C%20Saskatchewan">Census Division No. 17</a> and <a href="SARM%20Division%20No.%206">Division No. 6</a>.
History.
The RM of Frenchman Butte No. 501 incorporated as a rural municipality on January 1, 1954. It was formed through the amalgamation of the RMs of Paradise Hill No. 501 and <a href="North%20Star%20No.%20531%2C%20Saskatchewan">North Star No. 531</a> on December 31, 1953.
Geography.
Communities and localities.
The following <a href="List%20of%20municipalities%20in%20Saskatchewan%23Urban%20municipalities">urban municipalities</a> are surrounded by the RM.
The following unincorporated communities are within the RM.
The RM also surrounds <a href="Seekaskootch%20119">Seekaskootch First Nation Indian Reserve No. 119</a> and borders <a href="Makaoo%20120">Makaoo 120</a>.
Demographics.
In the <a href="2016%20Canadian%20Census">2016 Census of Population</a> conducted by <a href="Statistics%20Canada">Statistics Canada</a>, the RM of Frenchman Butte No. 501 recorded a population of living in of its total private dwellings, a change from its 2011 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2016.
In the <a href="2011%20Canadian%20Census">2011 Census of Population</a>, the RM of Frenchman Butte No. 501 recorded a population of , a change from its 2006 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2011.
Government.
The RM of Frenchman Butte No. 501 is governed by an elected municipal council and an appointed administrator that meets on the second Thursday of every month. The <a href="Reeve%20%28Canada%29">reeve</a> of the RM is Barbara Bonnie Mills-Midgley while its administrator is Mae Rotsey. The RM's office is located in Paradise Hill.
